website_summaries.verdict: Precision tuning anytime, thanks to motorized rotation and remote control, is a defining feature of this robust directional antenna.
pros: Motorized rotation is a convenient plus, allowing for fast tuning
Easily picks up signals at 60 miles+, even when mounted lower to the ground
Easy to put together and rig to longer masts if needed
cons: Must be repositioned often for the best reception
Vanes are a bit flimsy and caution is needed when assembling
Rotator’s motor can fail or malfunction

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna and a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the antenna on a 40 foot mast and it pulls in channels that I did not know we had. I can only give it four stars because the box that rotates the antenna was DOA and I had to order another antenna to get a good part, now I will be sending it back along with the bad box in the morning. A side note, it is connected with 200 FT of cable and I am getting a 90% signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Franz

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Range
customer_reviews.text: Antenna picks up TV stations in excess of 60 miles away with very good picture quality. The issue with the antenna is, it is made of aluminum and plastic. They break very easily so they must be handled very gingerly. Also, they do not stand up well in thunderstorms. High winds can damage them. Also, after rotating the antenna to get the best picture, the antenna will rotate off station during a moderate wind. If the antenna did not break so easily, and it locked in place after steering the antenna to desired stations, it would be a very good product. As it is, it is just mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: TwinkleStarz

customer_reviews.title: It worked great until this last week and now it won't work ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this antenna about 3 months ago. It worked great until this last week and now it won't work at all. I have an orange light on the box preventing it from working. I can't even just plug it directly into the tv because that doesn't work either
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very reasonable price for an acceptable attenae
customer_reviews.text: Quality is a little suspect but I can get over 80 channels living between Chicago and South Bend IN. and they're all crystal clear without adjusting the direction Cheaply made so I wouldn't recommend using the rotater too often even though this is a featured function. Also I would always recommend mounting outside whenever possible. I've previously spent 5 times as much on attic mounted antennas and never got near as good reception as with this. Sufficient coax cable is included for most mounting locations.
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great antennae for the price. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. I don't regret this purchase. I can't attest to the 150 mile claim, as it will not pick up stations from a major city 120 miles away from me. However, it does work great for stations within 30 miles from my home. Indoor antennas did not work well for me, and this one picks up more stations with no didital cutouts like I experienced with all of the indoor models I have tried. I had another outdoor antennae a couple of years ago, and paid over $100 for it. This antennae outperforms it. Beware that the motor may not work well or for long. Mine is spotty, but seems to work better with the remote.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Cord cutter
customer_reviews.text: This was a great antenna short of a few downfalls. It did not come with a mount, I thought I'd be able to work around this but i was not able to. The power turn never did work correctly and the amplifier requires a dedicated cable so not able to split this up for my 3 TV's and Tablo. During my test it did get amazing reception and picked up an extra 6 channels to add to the 7 I was getting without an amplified antenna. I ended up putting my original unamplified antenna back up until I can find a good fix for the issues I was having but it did work well enough for us cord cutters
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worth a Try
customer_reviews.text: After one reads all questions pertaining to this HDTV Antenna one should be able to make a decent decision as to whether or not it might be suitable for one's use. I did so, and I came to expect limited performance. One research for my location stated that I would be able to receive 0 to 3 channels, most sources yielded 0. With the antennae aimed at a city 75 miles away across valleys, hills, small mountains, and our rising roof I was able to get 11 channels. It got 3 major channel networks , but not CBS. The picture quality is A+.
customer_reviews.author: Machina3

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but not even close to 150 miles
customer_reviews.text: Very good antenna for the price. I live at the beach and the majority of local channels are between a 46 & 78 mile radius. It picks up the stations within 72 miles, unfortunately that leaves out FOX & CBS which are 76 & 78 miles away (I thought 150 miles was asking a little much from this design). I put my homemade fractal antenna (not an attractive site) back on the pole & working on a more attractive one.
customer_reviews.author: Billy G.

customer_reviews.title: it works but the rotation part dose not work I ...
customer_reviews.text: it works but the rotation part dose not work I would not buy if they do not make right . just to day I put up took 4 hours to get up would not by if I know it only gets 34 channels . try channel master booster titan 2 mast mounted antenna preampliter with it would not get one channel at all . try pct ma2-8p kit a 8 port passive amplifier would not help or work if you only looking for two tv and 34 channels with no rotation then you got it if you want what it says it well do then do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Nowland

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT LED overpowers TV room.
customer_reviews.text: Works a little better than the inside $10 wall sticky antenna. I do live in a valley though 30+ miles from major cities. One thing that is really annoying is the bright red led bulb that you can't cover since its the remote receiver. I tried to cover it with tape, NG since the antenna wouldn't turn with the remote. The light is a deal breaker for me since it overpowers everything in the room at night. Oh, the motor base was stuck when I got the unit. I had to tap it a few times and luckily it started to work. I though it was broken and Amazon prime refunded me the purchase price. Now it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Ayoub

customer_reviews.title: Over Air Amplified Outdoor HDTV Antenna WA 2608
customer_reviews.text: I installed the antenna for one of my former high school classmates and she is very satisfied. On her old antenna she could only receive approximately 30 to 35 channels. With this antenna she gets 52, and they hold steady. A few will distort when the weather is very bad. This number received is in one direction. When the antenna is rotated she receive another 15 to 20. I like it so much that I bought one fro myself. We are in an area where there are approximately 70 over the air channels available. Thanks for good product.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It is impossible to know which location to place the antenna.
customer_reviews.text: The motor control is worthless since you have no way of knowing which direction the antenna is located unless you walk in and out of your house each time you press one of the red buttons. The two buttons have the same function and nothing tells you which way the antenna is moving, clockwise or counterclockwise. I called and they were rude, snappy and not helpful at all. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Lear

customer_reviews.title: I installed it in my attic which I recommend in order to protect the antenna from movement in ...
customer_reviews.text: Brings in all local stations in my area up to 50 miles away. It was necessary to find a place with a clear view of the sky between my house and the main transmitter in NYC area. I installed it in my attic which I recommend in order to protect the antenna from movement in the wind. Moving the antenna seems detrimental to signal strength.
customer_reviews.author: JMIII

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you love climbing up on the roof every few hours.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a couple of months. Then it stopped working. The LED light on the controller was illuminated so I climbed the ladder to see if I could find the problem at the antenna. The LED light on the bottom was not on. As soon as I turned the antenna motor by hand, the light came on. I went inside and found that I was getting great reception again... for about 8 hours. Then it quit. Back up the ladder. Turn the antenna by hand. Fixed. This is a great antenna if you love climbing ladders up to your roof.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: Instructions to put this antenna together and attach are almost ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions to put this antenna together and attach are almost impossible to follow as the pictures are small and the photos are not helpful and are unclear. There are few words. There is no explanation of how it is supposed to work - how the electricity is connected to the rotator, for instance. The customer needs better instructions about where to place the controls and how to attach them. This company needs to learn how to communicate with its customers. It was very frustrating and I returned the antenna to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Florida

customer_reviews.title: antenna and rotor delivered with substandard Video Cable and it ...
customer_reviews.text: antenna and rotor delivered with substandard Video Cable and it had to be replaced with industry standard Coax and connectors, requiring additional purchase of tools from AMAZON(which were excellent) to provide a few weeks service till the amplifier used with the antenna got very fussy about when it would choose to work unless the coax TO it were arranged or held JUST right. The antenna itself is in service [without the rotor and the amplifier control box] used with the amplifier from another Long distance TV antenna
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this antenna....so many channels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a last resort. I couldn't watch many local channels due to rural living and massive tree coverage. I bought this as a last resort. I had tried wall mounts, indoor/outdoor models with longer range and this one did the trick! I am so happy that I can watch my fav channels again without pixelating and losing picture signal. This antenna is adjustable by remote, so rarely if you have reception issues, this is one to try, you won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: RogueGirl

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Booster and rotator function does not really add anything to this product. Booster/rotator box got very hot and I didn't dare keep it plugged in. Replaced it with a stationary antenna from a local vendor that worked just as well since once best reception position is found, there really is no need to rotate the antenna. Ended up tossing the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: RuJa

customer_reviews.title: Picks up stations 50+ miles away easy.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted it in my attic under your garden variety asphalt shingles. Works great. Would very much buy again. Also the motorized adjustment is a nice feature-- I don't use the adjustment, but when I was testing it out, the antenna moved at a pace that was a happy medium of speed and precision. If you are worried about poor reception-- this one is probably your best bet. I live next to Lake Erie and the broadcasting towers I am picking up are legitimately over 50 miles away to my southwest.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Simple and powerfull.
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure about the antenna at first. It's not very big. Assembly was straight forward and easy. My antenna is mounted high. About 30 feet up. Where you aim it makes a big difference in what you recieve. Being able to rotate it from the living room is cool. Only problem is that you need someone outside to monitor the direction of the antenna. I pick up a lot of channels. It works. Plain and simple.
customer_reviews.author: fishfuz

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about 4 months now with no issues. I get 65 channels and I'm about 52 miles from transmitter farm in Houston. I have it mounted outside on Vilso antenna mount. The motorized rotator makes it easy to dial in for best signal . The only con's I have is 1 that bright red light and 2 not knowing the direction its pointing, it seems if you stop holding the button down and push it again it reverses direction easy to loose your place .
customer_reviews.author: WELDON P DAVIDSON

customer_reviews.title: Pass.
customer_reviews.text: Worked OK for 3 months. No where near 120 mile range though. Stations 50 miles away would not come in good. We live in south Louisiana so our terrain is pretty flat. My 80 mile range antenna works better.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It has worked well for a while now and we really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a really rural area in the middle of nowhere, and we still get 3 channels. You cant beat free TV. there are websites you can type in how many channels you can expect to get in your area, and we picked them all up! It has worked well for a while now and we really like it. *I am just updating my review and this antenna has been working really well and we have been using it for a long time. we all really like it!
customer_reviews.author: rw

customer_reviews.title: ABC, NBC, CBS, FOX, and the rest - great if you are outside of the 60-mile range for major networks.
customer_reviews.text: 40+ (watchable) channels - boom! It's on a stand in my attic right now (haven't mounted outside yet), and I'm exactly where I wanted to be channel-wise. I'm only a few miles beyond the capability of a 60-mile antenna, which is a pisser. Expect to see a few more channels once properly mounted outside, but if not, I'm happy with its output in the current state.
customer_reviews.author: Charstoy

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Not bad as far as reception but very cheap construction. I made the $2 HDTV antenna from YouTube and it gets just as many channels. Keeps locking up and wont turn. I plan on returning it and getting something different. You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Vaz Man

customer_reviews.title: I bought this thinking it's advertised range would out perform ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it's advertised range would out perform my existing roof mounted antenna. It did not. Why the four stars? Because the included amplifier was exactly what my existing antenna needed to pull in the last few missing signals. So 5 stars for the amplifier, and 3 for the antenna, which could not out perform my existing classic roof antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Lower

customer_reviews.title: InstallerParts Amplified Outdoor HDTV Antenna... InstallerParts
customer_reviews.text: Don't Believe the 150 Mile Range ! I Have Station Towers about 90 Miles (As a Crow Fly's) West of Me , & 60 Miles (As a Crow a Crow Fly's) East of Me , Pointing West = 0 Channels :-( ! ! ! Pointing East 10 Very Clear Digital Channels . . . Antenna Does Work ! But True Range is Something Less Than 90 Miles (As a Crow Fly's) . . . Unless You Are Way Up on a Hill , or Have a Very Tall Tower to Put Antenna On , Then Range Might Be a Little Better . . .
customer_reviews.author: Jim Acton

customer_reviews.title: I regret to buy this junk.
customer_reviews.text: I regret to buy this junk. I had a single ClearStream passive antenna but wanted to get more strong signal. The Clearstream was 60+ miles and this is 150 miles. Wrong. This is 40+ miles at most. Signal is weaker even after the amplifier. I wish I could return this junk now. I already assembled and installed, so I have to disassemble and pack again. What a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: EricAllen

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: First off, I have to tell you that I do not have good reception in my area. The FCC website for DTV says that there are no channel within range, however, people have told me that they get 6-8 channels depending on where their antenna is pointed. The thing I like best about this antenna is the motorized direction part. With a flick of the remote, I can move the antennae around and point it in the direction that works best for me. I would highly recommend this antenna and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is our second antenna purchase. The first one we hooked up to our 55 inch tv in the living room after cutting cable and was surprised to see 35 channels. Some I didn't know the existed. Even though you can attach two sets to it I just bought another for the kitchen set which was easier then hunting done the existing cables and rerouting them. Now with this and Hulu I get all that we need without paying over $200.00 for cable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesnt work any better than my set top antenna!
customer_reviews.text: 150 MILES?????????? It doesn't pickup as many channels as my set top antenna can when I move it around, and I am only 1 mile from the nearest tower! All these antenna manufacturers should have their "claims" checked by consumer advocates at the very least. This is the Fourth brand I have tried and none of them meet their own claims. I live in the suburbs and there are nearly fifty channels available, while if point it right in the signal path I get about 15!
customer_reviews.author: NOO Body

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I live at least a hundred miles away from the closest Tower. This antenna picks up all of my channels crystal clear. It does come with a remote to turn the antenna automatically, but after you said it the first time it's not terribly useful. It does stay where it to supposed to. I definitely recommend this antenna for anybody trying to cut their cable costs.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second antenna I purchased that claims it’s over 100mile range, first one failed at its claimed range, this one actually performs. The stations are roughly 60-70 miles away, with hilly terrain in between, and this antenna does great! Both antennas mounted in same location, and there is no comparison, there was very little adjusting to get the right signal. I would recommend this antenna to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwell 315

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna for the price
customer_reviews.text: This antenna works great. I can get Tulsa channels from 100 miles away in NW Arkansas and if you are familiar with the terrain in this area, that's pretty impressive. It's easy to assemble/install and a great price. I get about 50 channels even with all the hills, valleys, and trees in this area. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Alien looking TV antenna works great.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice unit. Came well packaged with no damage in just 2 days. Took less than 30 minutes to assemble and only a few more to install and connect the wires. With in 5 minutes I has several good strong HD TV station even though my home is in a valley surrounded by hills. Well worth the money. Where there was none now there is HD TV with excellent video quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: TV antenna
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is ( GREAT ) I've had it on my roof for a while now and hurricane Irma came through Fort Myers Florida wrecking everything and Bloated it over sideways still picks up great only because of that is why I have Tv and of course my generator. I would highly recommend this to everyone and definitely buy it again. It seems very cheaply made but it has proven to be very tough. Buy it
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works really Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works really Great! The images are SO clear and sharp! I installed it on my roof - in San Francisco I get 81 Stations. The biggest problem is I can't see which way it is pointing when rotating it. It moves very fast BUT not always in the direction of the buttons on the remote say. It moves what ever direction it wants to go! I had to buy a camera to see how much to move it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great reception.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. This one I got for my mothers house. The reception is great. I put mine in the attic and works great. My Moms is up on the roof. The only concern it the plastic and how it will endure the sun. But for the price. This is an excellent buy and a top performer.
customer_reviews.author: Gene L.

customer_reviews.title: I live where mountains block signal. But this antenna ...
customer_reviews.text: I live where mountains block signal. But this antenna picks up more channels than I thought it would and I get all local channels and uhv 15. 45.51 61 and more Even with the high winds during the monsoons. Don't loose signal as much as the last antenna I had. My last antenna. I only could get a few channels and no uhv and weak signal when the wind blew
customer_reviews.author: Nenie

customer_reviews.title: Already broken...got a new one and broke already......
customer_reviews.text: update!!! I was sent a new antenna. After using tit the motor went out so it no long turns with the box... I have to manually turn it every time. I received the new antenna and it worked like a charm. Now within a month or so of receiving it it stopped working. There's no signal from it. the red light doesn't come on at all but there is power from the box in my house. This is very disappointing.... My antenna worked very well.... But it has already broken. Since it has broken i can't catch all the channels i use to.
customer_reviews.author: allie ponvelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product- 40 channels from 50 miles away
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I mounted it on a pole (bought separately) in my attic near the peak of my roof. I received 40 channels (28 unique stations) and I'm about 50 miles from the closest big city. I canceled my tv service and this product paid for itself in the first month. When mounting it, test it in several different directions and as high as you can get it. EDIT: no longer working
customer_reviews.author: Greyestfox

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: according to the dtv map, there are only 3 stations within 50 miles of me. I have 2 other antennas that are shorter range, 20 and 50 mile, but only rec'd 2 station I put this in my attic (literally just propped it up) and I get up to 36 channels at night, and about 10 during the day. Note, this needs a plug.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to assemble and hook-up
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and hook-up. I used it with a Vansky attic Antenna mount and fixed its position not using its rotor. We live near I-4 and state route 27. Aimed NE it brings in more than a 100 high definition television stations across Florida from its fixed position in the garage attic..
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bee

customer_reviews.title: I live in a condo and cable or indoor antenna ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a condo and cable or indoor antenna only option. Tried a couple indoor with little luck. With hurricane Irma coming, though i'd try it. Cost is right and small enough to put in little used area. So far works well and get 16 channels. Most (not all) channels transmitting antennas 50 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on a Motorhome in a campground in Wauchula Florida. It’s mounted on a 6 foot pipe it’s pointed to the South towards Naples-Fort Meyers but also picks up the Tampa stations to the North without rotating it North. That’s how good it is. It also withstood hurricane Irma.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in Sales

customer_reviews.title: Good directional antenna!
customer_reviews.text: Nice antenna! I'm using it inside my attic and it is sized about right for rotating while clearing the attics' interior.It's light weight made it easy to mount. I put it on the lower half of a broken torchiere lamp that had a heavy base. That way I can move it around in the attic should the need arise. It's easy to assemble and the rotator works quite well.

customer_reviews.title: It worked much better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: It worked much better than I thought. I live 50 miles from Philadelphia and I can pick up several stations from there. There is no way this will receive a station 150 miles away unless it is in line of sight. I have it in my 3rd floor attic indoors facing a window. Might get a few more stations if it was out side. I would have been sattified if it just got local station that are 20 miles away but it did much more.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Fielding

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and installed it on a pole where my satellite dish used to be up on the house make sure it was high and have pointed it towards the tower is but it’s just continually cuts in and out I thought I just might not have good service where I live a friend recently let me borrow his much cheaper indoor antenna pad and I get way more channels and don’t have any issues with it super disappointed in this purchase
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Wow -- Great Performance.
customer_reviews.text: Wow -- with a temporarily bad knee I couldn't install the antenna, so I jury-rigged it. It is sitting on a hot tub -- 20 ft. below normal installation, My present antenna is a $200 with amp and I cannot get a certain channel 40 miles away -- only a 7% signal. This antenna gives a 80% signal & terrific picture. All other channels are in the 80-85% range. The constriction seems a little lightweight, but for 27 bucks ???? I hope it lasts. Instructions are sparse, especially the operation instructions. Bottom line I'm a happy guy.
customer_reviews.author: R Cos

customer_reviews.title: good looking compact antenna
customer_reviews.text: It's a well made, good looking compact antenna. They supplied plenty of cable (about 40 feet of good co-ax) and they motor with remote works like a charm. Only issue is that my old antenna got ABC, CBS, NBC and Fox while in one position, but CBS doesn't come in with this one unless I move it slightly. Weird. A bit of a hassle. But it's a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Howard mackdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for me
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Can't believe this $30 antenna is so much better in reception than the indoor types bought in the past. The only suggestion is to use compression type of connector on one end of the cable so that users can bring it through the wall without drilling a big hole.
customer_reviews.author: Jz8084cc

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.  Remote never worked
customer_reviews.text: I'll update when in use but it was disappointing to put it together (easy) and find that the remote doesn't work. Too late to return. The junction box has a button that you can turn the antenna with but it's nearly useless. Update, booster box has entirely failed, we have no tv signal now. No apparent way to order another. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Pw Henderson

customer_reviews.title: My 3.95 flat plastic 20mile antenna functions better than this one.
customer_reviews.text: This antenna did not function as expected. I have a fully functional unamplified antenna here at the house. When plugging this one in, I was expecting a better signal, but received no signal.
customer_reviews.author: @thedannymullen

customer_reviews.title: work pretty good for a cheap antenna!
customer_reviews.text: gets all the local channels, and I don't have it mounted up very high, if I put it on a mast, I might get Tuscan, they show up in the guide, but don't come in at all. you may need to adjust the direction to get the best reception, takes a bit of trial and error, but once it is set , it works fine
customer_reviews.author: james giammarinaro

customer_reviews.title: Good price, looks sturdy enough for our hot weather
customer_reviews.text: Put together in fifteen minutes and installed in another 20. Replaced their cable with my RG6. Works perfectly. Get over 75 stations in Phoenix, AZ. Good price, looks sturdy enough for our hot weather.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David Rockville

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: The antenna is easy to install and it works great. We get all local stations and thanks to the remote controlled rotor adjusting optimal signal is simple as 1, 2 3!
customer_reviews.author: GJB

customer_reviews.title: I really liked how this was built
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how this was built, but I got one that just didn't work. The roto part worked fine, but amplifier basically didn't work. I picked up a better signal with an 18" loop of plain wire hooked to the end of the same coax. A friend got one that worked really well. I didn't feel like playing the roulette of exchanging over and over so I gave up. As and EE, it was designed correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moncsko

customer_reviews.title: Purchase was disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry to say that this unit did not perform as expected. Perhaps the TV stations in my area are not receivable as over-the-air stations. Unit could only pull in one station.
customer_reviews.author: Truck E-79

customer_reviews.title: Missing Screws
customer_reviews.text: Missing Screws, Works awesome, I got about 12 channels with another Antenna. With this one I get 57 about 45 in clear HD. I would recommend this one a 100%. Just make sure you have all the screws before try'n anything.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: It has a range of no more than 75 miles at best. Buying this product was a total waste of ...
customer_reviews.text: A very disappointing product. I had an antanna with a range of 70 miles and I got 21 stations with that product. I only got 8 stations with this antanna. This is not a true 150 mile range antanna. Most antanna manufacturers rate the range of their products from where it is located out in any one direction. The 150 range advertised by this manufacturer is a deception. It has a range of no more than 75 miles at best. Buying this product was a total waste of money. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Jones

customer_reviews.title: So much cheaper than cable
customer_reviews.text: Works great - getting just the local channels in a 50 mile radius but that is all I am looking for for free tV. So much cheaper than cable.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria D Roy

customer_reviews.title: When I replace the coax they gave me I'll likely get better receotion
customer_reviews.text: I went from 3 channels to 13 channels My TV volume control rotates the antenna. Not good. I wondered why I had to readjust the antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Verl

customer_reviews.title: This antenna was super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This antenna was super easy to assemble. When it was connected, I was pleasantly surprised. I'm getting 58 channels with all of the local channels coming through clearly. I would most definitely recommend this product, and will purchasing more for my family!
customer_reviews.author: 3ddotty

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Works well. We used one of these at a Ludington Michigan campground and received stations across Lake Michigan from Wisconsin stations. I installed on a pole to get better reception, but works well even at ground level. Bought this also for my sister/brother in law and they were pleased also.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: This antenna it does what you need when camping. ...
customer_reviews.text: This antenna it does what you need when camping. Trees will block the signal but that okay because you have remote to move it around to find channel.
customer_reviews.author: D.A.

customer_reviews.title: Antenna is good value and performance alternative to cable/satellie TV
customer_reviews.text: The antenna assembles easily and works really well. We were able to pull in about 25 surrounding channels which really surprised us. Free over the air TV combined with Hulu and Netflix streaming sure beats that huge monthly cable bill! On the negative side the mast mounting cup (molded plastic) on the antenna was undersize and would not fit my standard size antenna mast. I had to use a barrel sander to open up the cup and then drill set screws to secure the cup to the mast. If the mount had worked as designed, I probably would have rated it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Snow

customer_reviews.title: If you are close to the TV stations this may work well. Rotating the ant. when it works is pure guess work!
customer_reviews.text: Does not provide anything close to 150 Mi. Range. I have trouble with stuff 44 Mi. away. Motor Rotator is week and sporadic. I had a similar one of these in MI and it worked a little better. If you want good reception just bite the bullet and buy an old fashion established antenna and install your own distribution amp. I have now bought 2 of these 125 to 150 Mi. rated antennas and neither can work reliably at 40 to 50 miles.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Lolli

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding performance, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I just moved to a new apartment in Long Beach, California. I live behind another building and thought I'd get no reception at all. I pointed it loosely at Mount Wilson (~30mi away) and got 159 channels which was unexpected with the building between. I even set it up indoors, but will move it to patio. No cable tv subscription for me!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Might be good for inner
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, time and hassle. I am 23 mi from towers... this would not consistently hold the signal. Very disappointed. Might be good for inner city
customer_reviews.author: RHP in AZO

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome I loved mine so much I’ve told others and ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome I loved mine so much I’ve told others and they were skeptical so I have bought four of them for different friends and they love it. No more cable bills and I’m able to watch my local news that’s a big plus!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the local channels
customer_reviews.text: Bought a while ago for local channels. Has worked very well for picking up the broadcast channels. have used the rotating feature a few times when bad weather has caused it to have a weaker signal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I got more blue screens than a picture at all many times. Also, the motor to turn the antenna stopped working shortly after I bought it. I bought a different antenna and I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I am about 25 miles from the TV towers which are clustered together at the same location. I have solid reception on channel 10 and above that channel, but no reception on any channel below channel 10. Because of CCR's I can't put the antenna on an outside pole, which may be part of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: HDJ

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product, but for some reason I can't get ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product, but for some reason I can't get all the channels I wish...........out of 23 I get around 5 to 6 channels........but I believed it is because I'm about 40 miles from the city......
customer_reviews.author: Johnny G.

customer_reviews.title: you get a lot more channels
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work pretty good on signal , and video , my problem with it is that when you press the remote control buttons like the left button it doesn't always go to the left, and if you cannot see the antenna it is very hard to aim the it .
customer_reviews.author: Ivan 333

customer_reviews.title: Cannot pick up channels 50 miles away
customer_reviews.text: Antenna is suppose to be 150 mile range. Atlanta tv stations are 45 miles away from me. The antenna was mounted 35 ft from ground level but still could only barely manage one channel reception. Will be sent back.
customer_reviews.author: greg self

customer_reviews.title: Really pulls on the stations
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my RV TV antenna with this one and I get Waaaaay better reception than with the original antenna. It is not nearly as directional as some antennas are. I have pulled in stations from over 70 miles
customer_reviews.author: Steven E. Billings

customer_reviews.title: Stood up to Hurricans Irma!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna survived Hurricane Irma! The , Rotator" function works but...who knows which way it's turning or which way it pointing...or if it really turned at all. The amplifier inside the antenna is resilient against close RF transmitters that would overload most amplifiers. Still working great and bringing a great signal to our televison.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Carson

customer_reviews.title: Great for saving money
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Cable TV, over 100$ a month. This antenna and mounting, less than that... One time. I had one for over 5 years that was damaged by a mast failure - no fault of the antenna. Figure, $1200 per year is $6000 savings. Well worth the purchase. This is the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Techie customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reception.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several antennas and this inexpensive unit works best. It's the second one I have bought. The first lasted about two years. The Arizona heat and sun is hard on plastic. I'll buy another of these if this one goes bad.
customer_reviews.author: W. D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Amplified antenna
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is tremendously powerful, I live about 60 miles from the antenna that transmits the TV signal and after installing this antenna I have very good resection and I see more than 21 channels very well; It is also easy to install and really small. Received the antenna in time and in perfect conditions
customer_reviews.author: vmveiga

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me while another brand did.
customer_reviews.text: I have another brand of this same product which works and this one does not. possibly only works if the distance of antenna cable is not too long.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Brewster

customer_reviews.title: A great little antenna
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little antenna. Sort of flimsy, yes. But, it does the job. We are,'t 150 miles out, but probably 75 miles. It works great! Because of it's small size, my guess is that it might be useful in an RV application. It's small enough to be packed away and put up in a few minutes, once set up.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Roland Hyatt, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased to have the amp and rotator integrated
customer_reviews.text: Our big antenna took a tumble, and i took a chance on this, as it was cheap enough to. Very pleased to have the amp and rotator integrated, pulls in stations comparably to our larger one which was also amplified but aging. I do *not* love the fact that the rotator just sweeps to the end-of-travel then reverses, with no feedback at all.You have to WATCH the antenna to know if it will turn right or left. That bears improvement.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Voss

customer_reviews.title: It stood up to Hurricane Florence
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Cut the cord with the high cost of DirecTV and replaced their dish with this HDTV antenna and receive all local channels in my area 70 plus channels. HOA don't allow antennas on the roof but was not a problem for me. Everything works plus you get a RED light under your antenna neat at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kerwin

customer_reviews.title: beautiful reception. Easy to put together and install
customer_reviews.text: Receiving all stations up to 60-70 miles away, beautiful reception. Easy to put together and install. Parts I'm the box could've been packaged better. Thought there was a part missing, but found it after going through things three times. Would recommend this product so far. But have only had it for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: HELENE BLOUNT

customer_reviews.title: Works better then expected.
customer_reviews.text: used this as a backup to cable tv while riding out hurricane Irma in my area. Picked up all local channels and works well. Mounted inside my attic for protection to the elements and still works very well..
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischetti

customer_reviews.title: Still works 2 years later!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this 2 years ago. I mounted it outside on the roof. It still works great, I do have to rotate to get some stations but it only takes a few seconds. Im impressed the rotate function still works 2 years later.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Novak

customer_reviews.title: hard  to adjust
customer_reviews.text: The antenna fine works as expected but the directional part of it sucks. no way to determine what direction it is moving. That really sucks when you can't see it from ware your watching TV and trying too adjust. It has 2 buttons for adjustment but that doesn't mean one goes one way and the other is to go the other way ass you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: karendreke

customer_reviews.title: could work better
customer_reviews.text: The antenna did not work as well as I hoped. It did not work any better than the cheaper indoor antennas I have tried. Our house is located on a hill just on the edge of the city. We do have several large trees around our lot.
customer_reviews.author: Larry O

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, install and it comes with everything but the pole.
customer_reviews.text: I put this together myself, bought a pole at Lowes and put it up. This antenna works great and with the auto direction option, its a breeze to get the most channels. And the picture is better than cable. I am on the west coast of Fl. about mid state neat the water and I get 52 channels. some are not my style, but they are there. I am dumping the cable!!
customer_reviews.author: greaseguy

customer_reviews.title: Stood up to 50 mph winds
customer_reviews.text: Stuck this on the roof and I got 77 channels. Many of those are sub channels but I got em' We had 50 mph winds the other day and it did not have any trouble with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ray

customer_reviews.title: Easily pulls in stations from 59 miles away.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy and the instructions were good. I initially set it up in my kitchen and hooked it up to my TV. I received 42 off air channels! I’ve moved it outside and now get 43 channels. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Byrne Sr.

customer_reviews.title: VHF signal output is VERY weak.
customer_reviews.text: Antenna works pretty well. Will bring in lots of UHF stations. VHF, not so much. Rotor for antenna is crap. It broke fairly quickly, but once you point the antenna and set it up, it shouldn't need to be moved again. I will be replacing this antenna, because of the weak VHF signal, and since it is amplified, I can't attach a VHF antenna to it. So, overall, pretty much crap.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described, picked up around 25 channels out of Atlanta. I am around 60 miles out of Atlanta.
customer_reviews.author: DJP

customer_reviews.title: Antenna worked great for about the first three weeks then the amplifier ...
customer_reviews.text: Antenna worked great for about the first three weeks then the amplifier quit working and now i get no signal. Pretty bummed out after putting in effort to get it set up on the roof. Wish I could get the amplifier replaced. I feel i didn't get my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting 20 channels with this thing and FREE HD I'm loving it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gil.S

customer_reviews.title: Good for 60 miles
customer_reviews.text: This really does pull in channels--but--I doubt it will work for 150 miles away stations. I am 52 miles (avg) from the Tampa stations and I get a nice clear picture--MOST of the time.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hiemenz

customer_reviews.title: Well, how can it work without directions?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when promised. Decent assembly instructions but absolutely no operating instructions! So I guess I am supposed to sit in front of the TV and just push buttons until I get the right combination? If I don't get acceptable results in 2 days I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: SmokinRoach

customer_reviews.title: Bit cheaply made but efficient
customer_reviews.text: Works but cannot pickup hdtv signals. Antenna itself is relitively cheaply made giving its an outdoor unit but for the price it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: geoffrey walker

product_meta.title: InstallerParts Amplified Outdoor HDTV Antenna -- 150 Miles Long Range -- Motorized 360 Degree Rotation -- Wireless Remote Control
feature_bullets: EASY INSTALLATION: Our outdoor HDTV antenna comes with an easy-to-follow user installation guide so you can install the antenna with ease.

LONG RANGE HD RECEPTION: This yagi antenna can capture 1080p HDTV reception and 32db high gain reception within a 150-mile range, making this the best long range TV antenna. Additionally, our outdoor TV antenna includes a built-in super low noise amplifier to enhance reception.

BUILT-IN FEATURES: Our digital TV antenna includes a built-in 360 degree motor rotor to allow you to find the best reception. Adjust the long range HD antenna with the included wireless remote control from inside the comfort of your home.
WEATHER RESISTANT: This amplified TV antenna is fully functioning in the outdoors and can handle any type of weather pattern, making it one of the best antennas for consistent HDTV reception.

90 DAY NO QUESTION RETURNS: We understand that HDTV reception can vary depending on a number of factors. While most are satisfied with the InstallerParts HDTV antenna, if for any reason you are not, we will accept your return within 90 days for a full refund.
